## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
Hey, I've been learning about DeFi and I have a question about Verus. How does the Verus DeFi protocol address the issues of miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running?

**AI Assistant:**
The Verus DeFi protocol addresses the problems of miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running by ensuring that all currency conversions using a particular liquidity pool and mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously. Additionally, it provides fee-based DeFi integrated incentives to miners and stakers, ensuring smooth consensus operation and fee conversion capabilities by integrating DeFi liquidity pools directly into the consensus and cross-chain bridge protocols.

**User:**
That makes sense. I've also been wondering, what's unique about the launch of a new blockchain on Verus?

**AI Assistant:**
On Verus, the launch of a new blockchain is accompanied by the simultaneous launch of a fully decentralized or centralized "bridge" converter liquidity pool. This liquidity pool is bound to the launch of the new blockchain, runs on the new blockchain, and all fees generated via cross-chain fee conversions or general use of the liquidity pool are earned on the new blockchain, with no rent going back to the Verus blockchain. This is a unique feature of Verus that sets it apart from other blockchain platforms.

**User:**
That's really interesting. I've also been looking into crowdfunding options on Verus. What options are available for customizing a blockchain-based crowdfunding currency launch on Verus?

**AI Assistant:**
On Verus, users can customize their blockchain-based crowdfunding currency launch by setting maximum participation in one or more currencies, offering pre-launch discounts, and making price-neutral pre-allocations to select IDs that increase the fractional reserve ratio to issue currencies. Additionally, users can also make price-neutral carve-outs. This allows for a high degree of flexibility and customization when launching a new crowdfunding currency on Verus.
How does the Verus DeFi protocol address the issues of miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running?

The Verus DeFi protocol addresses the problems of miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running by ensuring that all currency conversions using a particular liquidity pool and mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously. Additionally, it provides fee-based DeFi integrated incentives to miners and stakers, ensuring smooth consensus operation and fee conversion capabilities by integrating DeFi liquidity pools directly into the consensus and cross-chain bridge protocols.

ies backing the liquidity pool at a fractional percentage ranging from 5% to 100% backing. The Verus DeFi protocol ensures that all currency conversions that use a particular liquidity pool and are mined into one block are solved and priced simultaneously, addressing the problems of miner extracted value (MEV) and front-running, while providing fee-based DeFi integrated incentives to miners and stakers, ensuring smooth consensus operation and fee conversion capabilities by integrating DeFi liquidity pools directly into the consensus and cross-chain bridge protocols.
## Simultaneous blockchain and blockchain liquidity pool launches
 - Launch of a world class, worldwide, merge-mineable blockchain along with a fully decentralized or centralized “bridge” converter liquidity pool as part of defining a new blockchain. Bridge converter currencies have the same flexibility as other fractional 100% asset backed or partially asset backed currencies, but is bound to the launch of the new blockchain, runs on the new blockchain, and all fees generated via cross chain fee conversions or general use of the liquidity pool are earned on the new blockchain with no rent going back to the Verus blockchain, only seamless connectivity.
## Blockchain-based, crowdfunding currency launches with minimum participation or automatic refunds, including for dual launches (blockchain and bridge)
- Set required minimum levels of worldwide participation in your preferred currencies on chain. If by the start time of your blockchain, minimums are not met, all participants will automatically get a refund of all of their pre-conversions, less the network fees. The launch options also provide for maximum participation in one or more currencies, pre-launch discounts, price neutral pre-allocations to select IDs that increase the fractional reserve ratio to issue currencies, similarly price neutral carve-outs
